name: Nalanda University Ruins
description: The UNESCO World Heritage site of the ancient monastery complex featuring sacred meditation stupas, viharas, and extensive archaeological remains.

name: Hiuen Tsang Memorial
description: A stunning memorial hall dedicated to the famous Chinese scholar and traveler who studied at the ancient university in the 7th century.

name: Archaeological Museum
description: Housing a rich collection of antiquities, stone images, bronze statues, and terracotta pieces recovered from the excavation site.

name: Jal Mandir
description: A temple dedicated to the Sun God, located near the university ruins. It features a tank where Chhath Puja is celebrated with great devotion.

name: Kundalpur Digambar Jain
description: Believed to be the birthplace of Lord Mahavira, this site hosts beautiful temples with white marble architecture and serene surroundings.

name: The Great Stupa
description: The most iconic structure of Nalanda, Stupa No. 3, is a massive temple-shrine with multiple flights of stairs and votive stupas.
